paragraphs.text: The cover features Aang, Appa, Katara, Momo, and Sokka.

paragraphs.body: How to Draw Avatar: The Last Airbender (ISBN 978-1-56010-783-5) is a book based on ${link_0}, detailing how to draw twelve of the characters from the animated series. It was published in 2007 by Walter Foster and illustrated by Shane L. Johnson.
paragraphs.text: How to Draw Avatar: The Last Airbender (ISBN 978-1-56010-783-5) is a book based on Avatar: The Last Airbender, detailing how to draw twelve of the characters from the animated series. It was published in 2007 by Walter Foster and illustrated by Shane L. Johnson.

paragraphs.body: Get ready to enter into the world of "benders" as you learn to draw Aang, Katara, Momo, and the rest of the characters from Nickelodeon's hit show Avatar: The Last Airbender. This book teaches you with simple, step-by-step instructions - so grab a pencil and draw away!
paragraphs.text: Get ready to enter into the world of "benders" as you learn to draw Aang, Katara, Momo, and the rest of the characters from Nickelodeon's hit show Avatar: The Last Airbender. This book teaches you with simple, step-by-step instructions - so grab a pencil and draw away!

paragraphs.body: A "Tools and Materials" page telling what is needed to draw the Avatar: The Last Airbender characters comes first, followed by an "Avatar Character Size Chart", showing how tall each character is in relation to each other, and an "About Avatar" page, which has brief descriptions of the ${link_0} and ${link_1}. paragraphs.body: At the end of the book there is a page titled "Until Next Time", which briefly tells and shows how to use the Avatar drawings shown in the book to decorate items such as storybooks, cards, or posters, concluding the art book.
